FunctieomschrijvingOrganizational contextHR Expert Consultant works in close collaboration with the Global Head of Performance Management. Performance Management is part of the Performance & Reward team and focuses its activities on effectively running the performance management process and on developing a strong performance culture within the Bank. To go into further detail, the Performance Management team runs the performance management process at a Group level, while being responsible for the global roll out of the new Step Up program. The Step Up program is a redesigned performance management approach aiming at improving the performance of the Bank by moving us from a backward-looking review process to a real-time improvement process. The new Step Up approach will support the development of a strengthened ING Performance culture, aimed to improve the individual performance and professional development of all ING’s 54.000 employees. Key responsibilitiesHR Expert Consultant will be mainly involved in several work streams to fully roll out the global implementation of the new performance management approach for 2018 onwards. There will also be room to further develop managerial capabilities on performance management.The work streams will include, supporting countries in the full implementation of the new Performance Management approach, developing new training modules to support managerial capabilities and managing ING performance management knowledge on a global level (videos, documents, events) to maximize the development of a feedback culture within the group.The role will require a strong independency, clear delivery, make-it-happen mindset, merged with strong knowledge of learning methodologies.Functie-eisenKnowledge and experience Basic competenciesExtensive knowledge of and experience with at least two of the following expertise areasPerformance ManagementTalent and learningChange ManagementExtensive experience with running training/learning projectsAbility to analyze complex situations, extrapolate problems and taking timely decisionsAbility to persuade people and to rapidly respond to new situationsMonitors the progress of processes/projectsAdditional competenciesHave a can-do mentality and always meet deadlinesBe proactive in detecting and identifying problemsSpeak and write English fluentlyHave good knowledge on Excel and PowerPointProven experience in communicating with senior managementBehavioural competenciesHave a organized and disciplined way of working, with clear focus on setting priorities and end results achievementHave Assertive and analytical mind-set with good number agility and strong focus on detailsHave a clear customer focus and putting the client needs at the center of all activities, assuming personal accountability on deliverablesCan work independently, sticking to his/her principles despite external pressureHave international experience / worked in different cultural settings is considered a plusWorking area ING is a challenging international environment with a team of dedicated co-workers. Global HR, and especially Global Performance Management team is a team with a variety of nationalities and backgrounds. You will be part of an environment that is in a maturing phase where all team members are expected to help shape and build a successful global performance management program and to fully contribute to the global HR with their experience and background. Who are you? You have a strong drive and excellent working ethics. You have good communication skills and experience in successfully manage stakeholders. Due to the nature of the work you must have a high degree of accuracy. The job requires independence and initiative but is combined with working together in a team. This means that you must be able to prioritize and know how to integrate tasks. What do we have to offer you? A job in a dynamic and international environmentWorking hours of 40 per week How to apply?Apply directly online. Please enclose your CV as well as your motivation letter in English. For more information please contact Anna Kocon at anna.kocon@ing.com

FunctieomschrijvingCAS is a highly professional organisation with approximately 20 audit teams across the globe and comprises a diverse international team of around 300 members. You will be located in Amsterdam within the Lending Services audit team. This team is part of the CAS Audit Division Wholesale Banking. Together with your CAS colleagues, you will perform operational and application audits. Your work will include travel and cooperation with local audit teams. Working at CAS headquarter means that you will be operating at the very heart of the ING organisation. This also means that your work has the interest of regulators, external accountants and executive management. As an Audit Supervisor you typically have more than 8 years relevant work experience. You are able to actively lead the planning, execution and reporting process of audits, independently, with limited supervision & guidance needed, for areas involving multiple and senior stakeholders and which cover a varied array of topics. You supervise the work performed by the team, executes audit related work under high quality standards, coaches the auditors on the job, pro-actively gives feedback on the progress, foresees and acts on avoiding bottlenecks in the audit process, drives the kick off and close-out presentations, prepares high quality draft audit reports. The main activities and responsibilities for an audit Supervisor are:- Provides input to the Audit Strategy Memorandum, Audit universe and the yearly Audit Plan- Maintains a professional relationships with the audit clients. Maintains an internal and external network. Manages expectations of auditees, through active communications.- Executes and supervises complex audits independently, with limited supervision & guidance required- Drafts Audit Planning Memorandums. Plans resources to individual audits in line with the allocated budget and timing. As Audit Lead - initiates and manages the kick off and close out audit meetings, communicates to and agrees with the auditee. Executes audit related work under high quality standards, reviews the audit work and ensures that the audit evidences obtained support the conclusions drawn.- Manages a complex audit process within the agreed constraints and is responsible for the timely closure of the audit files. Prepares high quality draft audit reports which include the identified control weaknesses and which are written in a clear and concise manner.- Keeps up to date on developments in the field of auditing. Has a thorough understanding of the areas subject to audits. Applies in-depth knowledge. Encourages knowledge sharing amongst colleagues.Functie-eisenFor this position we are looking for the following profile:- (at least) Master Degree in Auditing- More than 8 years relevant work experience. Preferred in (internal / external) auditing and/or a position providing a sound and wide-understanding of the organisation, governance, products and services; in a (global) financial institution or “Big” 4 external audit company- Ability to independently plan and execute complex audit assignments;- Ability to actively promote and explain CAS vision, way of thinking & way of working in and outside audits.- Independence and professional scepticism. Acts on audited convictions rather than on a desire to please. Sticks to principles despite external pressure; Able to challenge the existing patterns;- Strong organization and follow up skills including ability to handle competing priorities and meet deadlines and commitments;- Persuasiveness: Able to use indirect influence;- Able to make complex analyses & synthetize key underlying messages in verbal & written communication;- Team Leadership: Stimulates team work, gives feedback and coaches on the job. For more information please contact Pawel Debosz at pawel.debosz@ing.com

FunctieomschrijvingPeople  Analytics is a young team, rapidly developing ING’s People Analytics capability across the group. Our purpose is to ensure HR decisions at ING are driven by facts. The team applies advanced analytical techniques to provide data driven insights on what really matters to employees and which human capital investments really drive business results. The team sits within the Global HR organisation, in a dynamic, evolving environment. Your roleAs a Senior Consultant you will be the sparring partner to (senior) Management. You will be responsible for leading projects, driving business development, translating business requests into data requirements (and vice versa), pushing forward change initiatives and bringing transformation in the area of People Analytics. We value your consultancy and communication skills as much as your analytical skills!You are able to secure the successful implementation of People Analytics projects, by being sensitive to the distinctive needs of each business situation, by dealing confidently with senior stakeholders, by liaising with different departments and gathering together all the necessary resources, by communicating results into the precise, easy-to-understand outcomes, and by making sure analytical insights are translated into a meaningful direction and advice for (senior) Management. You will use your business development skills for the strategic growth of ING’s People Analytics capabilities. Key responsibilitiesYou are on the front line, identifying business priorities and liaising with senior stakeholders;You lead advanced People Analytical projects and work on complex questions around Reporting, Dashboards and benchmarking;You evaluate business needs, research business questions, carefully plan projects and bring together all necessary resources in order to carry them out successfully;You combine stakeholder’s request with external information and conduct a primary research together with the team;You present outcomes in a meaningful and accessible way, provide management direction and advice;You support ‘cases for change’ in the HR domain with relevant information and metrics;You are proactive and innovative, discovering and proposing new initiatives and prospective opportunities for the strategic development of HR and the business;You always keep track of internal and external developments in the area of big data, analytics, applications and translate this into new initiatives focused on improving analytical capability;You build a strong international (internal and external) network of professionals in the field;From time to time you will deputise Head of People Analytics team.Functie-eisenKnowledge, experience and required competenciesYou have at least 7 years of relevant work experience – preferably in the international consultancy or financial services sector;You have a master’s degree and affinity with analytics;You have advanced knowledge of human resources, organisation development and/or business strategy;You have strong analytical, consultancy and business development skills;You are able to have impact and bring change;You are experienced in excel and statistics packages like SPSS or Minitab;You have excellent English communication skills and are able to craft findings and recommendations into the business language of your stakeholders;You thrive in a demanding international work environment;You are a great team player, able to actively engage your colleagues by sharing, giving and asking for help.   We offer:Great conditions in a full-time position based in Amsterdam;Top level People Analytical projects & the opportunity to be part of building a world class analytics team;High degree of autonomy and opportunities to develop your career;International team and work environment;Competitive relocation package for expats.  Interested?Please apply online.For more information please contact Arthur Krovka at arthur.krovka@ing.com

FunctieomschrijvingRSM heeft voor de regio Rotterdam een vacature voor eenAssistent Accountant ControlepraktijkDit ben jij als Assistent AccountantAls assistent accountant werk je in een team met junior assistent accountants en (senior) assistent accountants. Het grootste gedeelte van de tijd zit je bij de cliënt. Jaarlijks werk je voor verschillende opdrachtgevers in verschillende branches in het grotere MKB. Begeleiding en ondersteuning krijg je van de controleleider. De werkzaamheden bestaan voornamelijk uit controleopdrachten, maar daarnaast zal je ook samenstelwerkzaamheden verrichten. Communicatie is een belangrijk onderdeel van je werk. Functie-eisenJe volgt een universitaire opleiding tot registeraccountant en hebt twee jaar relevante werkervaring binnen de accountancy. Tevens verwachten wij dat je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, teamgeest en inzicht in de problematiek van de ondernemer. Voor ons kantoor in Rotterdam zijn wij op zoek naar een assistent accountant. ArbeidsvoorwaardenWe willen dat je je ontwikkelt. - Onze medewerkers worden zo goed en breed mogelijk opgeleid. We blijven je prikkelen, we gaan voor de lange termijn-relatie. Wij zien het als een uitdaging om jou naar een hoger niveau te brengen. Daarom bieden we je opleidingen, kansen en intensieve begeleiding.Je bepaalt je eigen carrière. - Bij RSM leer je snel, ontwikkel je je snel en geef je zelf richting aan je carrière. Je staat er nooit alleen voor, maar je hebt de back-up van ervaren collega’s, een landelijk netwerk en een internationale organisatie.Goede werksfeer. - We bieden je een uitdagende, motiverende omgeving waarin je je optimaal kunt ontwikkelen.  De informele sfeer in het team is goed en daar draag jij aan bij, want jij bent onderdeel van het team. Als jij een leuke organisatie zoekt met doorgroeimogelijkheden, dan ben jij bij ons aan het juiste adres.Het draait bij ons niet alleen om hard werken. - Natuurlijk werken we hard, maar werken is niet het enige dat we belangrijk vinden. We houden de balans tussen werk en privé goed in de gaten. Want een medewerker die goed in z’n vel zit, presteert beter.Werken bij RSMOmdat we het belangrijk vinden dat je blijft groeien, investeren we in je ontwikkeling en begeleiden we jou zo goed mogelijk. We willen het maximale uit jouw talent halen. Hoe hard je gaat, hangt van jou af. Ben jij de ambitieuze werkstudent die wij zoeken? We willen je graag leren kennen.  SollicitatieprocedureMeer informatie? Mail Alexandra van den Berg (HR): avdberg@rsmnl.nl of bel haar op 023-5300400. Solliciteren op de functie van Assisitent Accountant ControlepraktijkHeb jij interesse? Dan nodigen wij jou van harte uit om te reageren. Laat je CV en motivatie achter via onze sollicitatiepagina, door te klikken op de solliciteerbutton.Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.Trefwoorden: Accountant, Registeraccountant, Accountancy, Accountant Assistent, Financieel Medewerker, vacature RotterdamBedrijfsomschrijvingRSM is wereldwijd het zesde netwerk van zelfstandige accountancy- en belastingadvieskantoor met ruim 800 kantoren in meer dan 120 landen en ruim 43.000  professionals. Met 450 professionals verdeeld over 11 vestigingen in Nederland staat RSM midden in de maatschappij. De lokale betrokkenheid, gecombineerd met de regionale expertise en het internationale RSM-netwerk maakt RSM tot een uitstekende sparringpartner voor middelgrote organisaties. In Nederland is RSM gevestigd in Alkmaar, Amsterdam, Eindhoven, Haarlem, Heerlen, Maastricht,  Roermond, Rotterdam, Schiphol, Utrecht en Venlo. Al onze kantoren zijn actief op het gebied van accountancy, belastingadvies en advisering op financieel-economisch en strategisch gebied. Ook beschikt het netwerk over specialisten op het gebied van Valuation, Merger & Acquisition en Risk Advisory Services. RSM biedt het kwaliteitsniveau van een groot kantoor met de nadruk op persoonlijke aandacht en betrokkenheid. Daarnaast beschikt RSM over een eigen Vaktechniek- en Opleidingsbureau.

Job_title: Legal Counsel - Bank Strategy and Funding / Legal Financial Markets
Text: FunctieomschrijvingAs Legal Counsel in the Bank Funding & Strategy team you will be responsible, among others for:     Providing top notch legal advice to stakeholders on regulatory issues, such as Benchmark Regulation, MiFID II, Wft, EMIR etc.;Participation in various internal implementation work streams together with members from Credit Risk, Compliance, Operations, Front Office and Value Chain Management and in the translation of legal and regulatory requirements into technical specifications for systems and processes including the impact on our trading and sales set-up, products and services;Maintaining contact with regulators and external counsel;Participation in industry working groups and monitoring global and local regulatory developments.Functie-eisenExperience and qualification required:Master’s degree in law (LLM) and preferably a post doc (e.g. Grotius); At least seven years of legal practice or compliance experience within a reputable law firm, a financial services company or regulator;Proven knowledge and understanding of key regulations impacting financial markets. Basic understanding of financial markets’ products, processes and documentation;Ability to interpret complex laws and regulations and produce clear, practical guidance; and the impact hereof on ING;Strong analytical and interpersonal skills;Energetic and enthusiast team player;Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Dutch. What we offerA dynamic and supportive international environment;A varied and interesting role on the highest level;Training both on the job and externally (e.g. Grotius);A fulltime role of 40 hours per week in Amsterdam andMarket conform remuneration. Interested?Apply directly online, click on Apply for this job. Please send your CV and motivation. We are looking forward to your application!For more information please contact Łukasz Wolski at lukasz.wolski@ing.com

FunctieomschrijvingAs Legal Counsel working at Wholesale Banking Legal you will work with the WB Advanced Analytics (WBAA) teams to further strengthen their understanding of the applicable laws and regulations and to help creating and implementing a vision on data use, data management and product innovation from a Non-Financial Risk (NFR) perspective. You will liaise with the larger organisation and provide expert guidance to the Wholesale Banking Advanced Analytics team. What department?Wholesale Banking Legal Lending & PCM is a department of 25 lawyers responsible to support WB businesses active in data use & data management, lending, payment and cash management. Our expertise ranges from product development, process improvement, transaction support to providing guidance on relevant legal developments. The department acts as centre of expertise for the WB network and is connected to various interbank working groups.WBAA is a team of 40 people that has the mission to make Wholesale Banking in ING data driven. We do this by combining Big Data technology with Data Science to deliver high value solutions and products for our organization. We work in a fun and creative environment and we’re dedicated to bringing out the best in both each other and our projects. You’ll be part of the Non-Financial Risk squad within WBAA, which is without a doubt the best part JJob descriptionDo you have a vision on where data analytics should go? What it would mean to do analytics ‘the right way’? Would you like to work with people who all want to be the best in their fields? Do you like ping pong and wearing a t-shirt to work? Search no further, if you answered all of the previous with yes, you want to work at Wholesale Banking Advanced Analytics.You will shape how the Wholesale Bank interacts with data from an NFR perspective while working within a complex environment and building and maintaining relationships with other (legal) departments to collaborate with you and the rest of the team to further your vision. Furthermore, you will provide guidance to the project teams of WBAA in how they can make their projects as successful as can be. You combine both thinking of the future and a hands-on, right now attitude. You will work with highly skilled people and enjoy a creative atmosphere where trying things out is encouraged. What you will be doing Provide dedicated legal support to the WB Advanced Analytics team of 35 people that has the mission to enhance WB at ING by creating data driven algorithmic products. By combining Big Data technology with Data Science to deliver high quality products.Act as one of the legal experts on all the applicable law areas that WBAA comes in touch with, mainly privacy, contract and competition lawGive guidance and advice to the project teams of WBAA on legal matters that they encounter and provide permanent and ad hoc legal training to colleagues of WBAATaking part in the development of legal tools (dashboards, quick reference cards etc) that support the WBAA business activitiesWork together with other NFR teams. Work with agile techniques in a fun and creative environment dedicated to bring out the best in both each other and our projectsFunctie-eisenDo you recognize yourself in this profile:A university degree in Dutch law or equivalent foreign degree with focus on privacy law1 to3 years of proven, relevant legal working experience within a commercial organisation, at a regulator or law firm1 to2 years of experience in the field of privacy and data use/managementIn-depth knowledge of  privacy (e.g. GDPR), contract law and  (preferably) competition lawExcellent communication skills both spoken and in writing in English and preferable DutchHands-on experience in building and maintaining relations with other departments in a complex environment, a collaborative mind set, proactive and open minded  What we offerFun!A competitive salary job scale 9/10Working with highly skilled peopleWorking in an area which is of great importance to the strategy of INGA relaxed and fun teamAn International atmosphereA full time position (40 hour week)Great training and education opportunities For more information please contact Anna Kocon at anna.kocon@ing.com

FunctieomschrijvingWe are looking for an experienced and driven Consultant/  Business Analyst for the tribe Statutory and Regulatory Reporting: this tribe delivers reports and solutions meeting the standards set by external local and central regulators and auditors. You will be a part of a dynamic agile organization and work in a liquidity reporting change team. The Finance COO department delivers Finance-related services to its stakeholders, i.e. Group Finance, country CFOs and Wholesale Banking, Risk, Tax and Bank Treasury. These services encompass operations and change initiatives for accounting, reporting, utilities, data foundation and business advice services, including system, process, data and information management and analytics capabilities. Change is delivered in accordance with the Finance strategy and implementation and decommissioning roadmap. The Business Analyst reports to the Chapter Lead. Your working environment As a BA, you work in a squad with around 8 colleagues from different areas of expertise. Together, you work on a common purpose. You like to work together in a multidisciplinary squad. Together with your squad members, you do everything within your power to realise your team mission day by day. What we are looking for We are looking for an energetic and driven expert with strong analytical capabilities who uses state-of-the-art methods and techniques for business analysis. You have integral, domain-exceeding knowledge of Finance.You are an excellent communicator and able to build bridges between different stakeholders. You are able to convincingly put forward your proposals and are a real team player in reaching broad agreement on the road to follow. What you will be doing You analyse complex Finance liquidity issues that go beyond squad and/or tribe boundaries, with a view to designing complete solutions for the requested change.You deliver excellently substantiated analyses using state-of-the-art techniques and tools, which lead to functional designs that cover all change deliverables. You are focused on process design and the translation to IT.You support the Finance Journey Expert (FJE) and take care of the coordination of content between the different FJEs and specialists from the different domains. You ensure that all requirements of all relevant stakeholders are acknowledged in the analyses and the different solution designs.You support tribes and squads in their decision-making by presenting the different (functional and solution) design alternatives and their impact in a clear way. You guarantee that the business requirements and non-functional requirements are translated into IT Solution requirements.You work together with (IT) architects and specialists to come up with a suitable IT solution. In doing so, you conduct a number of coherent analyses:Functie-eisen• Requirements analysis: you elicit sets of coherent requirements. You make sure that the requirements are complete, consistent, of good quality, that they are translated correctly in the design, and that they are maintained and, if necessary, adjusted if changes occur. You support the product owners and the squads in managing the backlog by translating and prioritising the epics into features and, together with the squad, into user stories.• Process analysis: you analyse the current situation, the problems that occur and the underlying causes. Based on this analysis, you provide clear process designs.• Information analysis: you analyse the necessary input, output, and adjustment of data in the client processes. You analyse the information need. You investigate the quality of the captured data and come up with solutions to improve quality.• Risk analysis: you are able to translate the policy and regulation of ORM, Compliance and Legal into design solutions. Next to performing these analyses:• You are able to explain and present the solutions clearly to stakeholders and receive their input and feedback. You provide them with (functional and solution) design alternatives and their impact, based on which decisions can be made.• Results of the analyses are captured in the chosen standards to make the implicit explicit (BABOK standards).• Your analyses are executed using Business Analysis products such as domain models, logical data models, impact analyses, feasibility studies, etc.• You substantiate choices and options on preferred solution(s) by drafting alternatives, feasibility studies, impact analyses, decision sheets and business cases.• You support the delivery of solutions with an iterative and incremental Agile approach by cooperating in refining the roadmap for overall solution(s) with partial deliveries (releases, minimal viable products) and by adjusting requirements and designs based on measurable experiences and feedback.• You support the verification and validation of solutions by analysing and setting up acceptance criteria based on the requirements and by defining scenarios and use cases.• You help to translate solution design into training material and work instructions for employees.• You introduce knowledge of best practices from inside and outside of ING. You contribute towards optimum reuse of solutions.• You make sure that lessons learned and (best and next) practices from your assignments are made available to everyone. You actively work on deepening and broadening the overall knowledge and experience. Your education, experience and background • Knowledge and experience with liquidity reporting (CRD IV).• Expert with strong business analysis experience, analytical skills, using state-of-the-art methods and techniques.• System experience with Moody’s is a pro.• Professional and intellectual ability at least at academic level.• University (Bachelor’s/Master’s) degree in (business) administration or information technology or a comparable field.• You have integral, cross-domain knowledge and experience.• You are a strong communicator and are able to present your analyses in a clear manner.• You have working knowledge of and practical experience with Agile.• You have knowledge of and experience in business and IT in areas such as process management and financial services.• Excellent communication skills in Dutch and/ or English.• You actively keep up your professional knowledge and translate external trends into applicable knowledge.• You are proactive and not afraid to take ownership beyond your job description.• You are a team player driven by the vision of reaching a common goal.• You continuously improve the way you and help others to grow.• You strive to work as a high-performing team, within you squad and your business analyst community.• Your organisational sensitivity enables you to judge and weigh the importance of the requirements of stakeholders.• You actively ask for help and feedback and are not afraid to give feedback.• You easily adapt to a new environment. We are looking for candidates in Jobscale 10 -12 Interested?If the above appeals to you we look forward to receiving your CV and strong motivation.Apply directly online, click on Apply for this job. For further inquiries, please contact Arthur Krovka at arthur.krovka@ing.com. We are looking forward to your application! For more information on vacancies please check www.ING.com/careers.

Job_title: Chief Data Officer within the Challengers & Growth Countries (C&G) COO domain
Text: FunctieomschrijvingYour work environment:The Challengers and Growth (C&G) COO team is a small head office function supporting the C&G countries with execution of and alignment with Bank strategy and global initiatives, focusing on Operations and IT. The focus areas covered are Operations, Sourcing, Control, Portfolio management, Data management and there is close cooperation with the C&G CIO head office function. What is Challengers & Growth?ING’s C&G business line is one of three core markets, serving circa 25 million customers in 10+ countries outside the Benelux and representing approximately half of ING's assets and profits. Our countries range from Europe to Asia and Australia, covering Retail and Wholesale customers and SMEs. Where does the role fit?The role we are offering is part of the recently created central C&G COO team. The C&G COO is located in Amsterdam and responsible for design and execution of INGs transformation strategy in all Challenger and Growth markets, and for coordinating all local COOs and combined 6000+ Operations staff in C&G countries. This role fits directly into this team as a senior leadership role, reporting to the C&G COO and functionally to the Group CDMO (Chief Data Management Officer).  The CDMO and C&G COO both sit on the COO Management Team at group level reporting to the Group COO.  The C&G CDO has functional lines from all CDO’s in the C&G countries and direct interaction with all COO’s. What would you be responsible for?The role of the C&G CDO is critical to ensure that the Global Data Management Strategy is rolled out across the C&G markets in a way that both supports the C&G business objectives whilst also ensuring that the standardisation approach globally is aligned and adopted:Oversee the C&G CDO functional team.Execute the GDM roadmap across all countries.Establish, communicate and execute the C&G specific Data Strategy.Ensure country executive committees understand in simple terms the Global and local data strategy components and buy into it.Support the local CDO organisations in growing expertise and delivering resources to execute the strategy in all parts (including Data Business Enablement, Data Governance, Quality, Availability and Transparency, Data Protection and Ethics).Developing a clear focus for BAU teams and execution of data governance and enablement in the current environment, including setting KPI’s aligned with business strategy.Developing a migration and benefits roadmap aligned with moving from the As-is to the To-be landscape with clear moments of truth and benefit on an incremental basis.Job description:For ING the CDO C&G is a newly created position and as such this newly created responsibility will also need to be set up. The CDO C&G will work closely with the COO C&G, CDMO and other senior business and technology stakeholders to define C&G data implementation strategy and key performance metrics. Simultaneously the CDO C&G will have to build a high performing functional team without having any hierarchical responsibility. In addition, the CDO C&G will serve as the bridge that aligns business on a local and global level. The CDO C&G will serve as a key partner, together with the CIO, to the senior leaders such as the CFO, CRO, Chief Compliance Officer and CMO to provide leadership and guidance in understanding how ING’s data assets, technologies and capabilities can be leveraged. Key responsibilities: Designing and driving the C&G data management strategy (governance, definitions, policies & processes, quality, organisational structure, architecture, privacy, security, sustained awareness, etc.);Safeguarding the overall C&G data and its quality  (trusted data – complete, accurate, consistent, and appropriate);Leading and fostering a culture that values, protects and uses information;Breaking down barriers / “ivory towers” / political challenges in order to ensure alignment with the Orange Code Behaviors and the Global Data Management Strategy;Aligning the appointment and dismissing of local data definition owners for data types (party, agreement, product, transaction, reference, pricing, operational/system/process, and derived data);Complying with the integrity of ING Esperanto (global logical data model);Functional ownership of the local data architectures;Measuring the C&G data maturity through the global data maturity model, and closing the gaps;Managing the risk regarding data creation, usage and retention for the reputation of ING;Fostering relationships with relevant CEOs/CIOs/COOs/OIB counterparties in order to align investment plans related to data management;Providing appropriate support for all officers involved in the data management of the C&G countries.Functie-eisenWho we are looking for?You have a strong background and proven track record in data management, preferably in an international context. You will need to have ambitious targets for your achievements and be able to share your positive energy with your business partners across C&G and the Bank. You must have outstanding social skills and the capacity to communicate effectively in an international environment. Collaboration and facilitation skills are key in this role. You must be transparent and able to facilitate discussions and alternative solutions. Experience and KnowledgeRequiredProven experience of managing global teamsExcellent understanding and experience in executing Data Quality, Data Warehouse and Data governanceProven track record in driving cross border, culturally diverse teams at a senior level within a matrix environment.Data Governance and Data Quality expertise and knowledgeData Privacy knowledgeData Architecture understanding, particularly of the elements that make up the data lifecycle.Knowledge of DAMA, DCAM or alternative industry standards and approaches (CMMI).Experience in managing data warehouses, MDM, BI and associated data elements.DesiredKnowledge of Policy formation, Customer Analytics, Business intelligence, Projects & Program management Experience wise the candidate should have the following: Required competencesTo meet the priorities of the position, candidates must possess the following core competencies and experience to be considered: Team Leadership that is able to attract and maintain a highly skilled team across numerous time zones and cultures. The candidate must demonstrate flexibility in style to bring out the best in people with different backgrounds and working styles, while unifying them in purpose, role clarity, and expectations related to deliverables. He/she must have a passion for ING’s emerging vision and mission and instil that passion within his/her team while also promoting the highest standards of ethics and compliance. Results Orientation as evidenced by a track record of delivering data solutions on time, within budget, and that routinely exceed the business process expectations and the financial return on investment targets of the business users. The successful candidate has demonstrated the ability to optimize execution and results versus settling for what is simply most practical, cost-effective, or easiest to execute. He/she should be organized, structured and diligent in setting time-bound objectives and navigating roadblocks and eliminating barriers to successful attainment of those objectives. FunctieomschrijvingThe Control Systems Group at the Electrical Engineering Department in Eindhoven University of Technology has an opening for a:Postdoc position for 1 year in the project `Integrating Sensor Based Process Monitoring and Advanced Process Control' (INSPEC).Project description:The INSPEC is a research project in cooperation with Radboud University Nijmegen (www.ru.nl), the Institute of Sustainable Process Technology (ISPT, ispt.eu), DSM (www.dsm.com) , FrieslandCampina (www.frieslandcampina.com) , CORBION (www.corbion.com) and Huntsman (www.huntsman.com). The goal of the project is to integrate quantitatively information from state-of-the-art Process Analytical Technology, process measurements and dynamic process models (data driven or physics-based) into Advanced Process Control. The research in INSPEC project at Control Systems Group concerns the alignment of rigorous models with actual process behavior with a predefined level of accuracy. The aim is to develop techniques for online calibration of dynamic models to actual process behaviour. The relevant research areas include identifiability of processes and parameter estimation, sensitivity analysis, optimal sensor location and selection of measurement. It is also the objective of the project to implement and analyze the developed technology on case studies provided by the industrial partners. The post-doc position is for 12 months and the work is going to be executed at TU/e collaborating closely with Friesland Campina in the analysis, modeling and control design of downstream processing of a lactose crystallization process including dryers and sieves. It is also expected to author and review technical reports and publications in internationally acclaimed journals, present research results both internally and externally. Group Description:The research mission of the Control Systems Group is to master complexity present in mechatronics, power systems, automotive systems and industrial processes. The group focuses on fundamental research in model reduction, spatial temporal systems, Lyapunov methods for real-time control and distributed systems, and system identification. Furthermore, many industrial projects are being carried out in the area of automotive, process control, wireless sensor networks, power systems. The group actively participates in the Dutch Institute of Systems and Control (DISC). For more detailed information on the activities of the group please check http://tue.nl/cs/.Functie-eisenThe ideal candidate is pro-active, highly motivated, and independent.The candidate has also affinity with giving lectures and has good written and oral communication skills in English. We are looking for candidates that match the following profile:A PhD degree in Electrical Engineering or related disciplines with excellent gradesGood publication record.A team player that enjoys coaching of PhD and Master students in multicultural teams.Good communication and organization skills.Excellent English language skills (writing and presenting).ArbeidsvoorwaardenWe offer an exciting job in the group Control Systems of the Eindhoven University of Technology: A full time appointment for 1 year at Eindhoven University of Technology www.tue.nl/en/Gross monthly salaries and conditions are in accordance with the Collective Labor Agreement of the Dutch Universities (CAO NU), scale 10 (between € 2588,00 and € 4084,00 depending on your experience).More information on employment conditions can be found here: www.tue.nl/en/university/working-at-tue/working-conditions/Interesting cooperation with the high-tech and process industry in- and outside The Netherlands.An attractive package of benefits, including end-of-year allowance, and excellent sport facilities.Additionele informatieInformationFor more specific information about this position please contact:  vacancies.cs@tue.nl.For information concerning employment conditions, you can contact:Mrs. Tanja van Waterschoot, e-mail: T.A.M.v.Waterschoot@tue.nl .ApplicationsInterested candidates with a background in systems and control, (applied) physics, mathematics, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or a related field are encouraged to apply using the 'apply now'-button. You should upload the following:A detailed curriculum vitae, a letter of motivation and portfolio with relevant work.A cover letter explaining your motivation and suitability for the position.A list of publications and key achievements in research project(s)).Contact information of two references.Copies of diplomas with course grades. Please keep in mind; you can upload only 5 documents up to 2 MB each.

Job_title: Lecturer in Software Engineering and Information Technology
Text: FunctieomschrijvingThe Information Technology (INF) group at Wageningen University is doing research and education on the topics of smart system engineering, and system-of-systems engineering which is primarily centered in the life sciences domain. In this context, we focus on software engineering, information management and socio-technical systems. With the rapidly increasing impact of IT on the life sciences domain the mission of the INF group has become even more important. To further strengthen our group the INF group invites applications for the lecturer position in the area of Software Engineering and Information Technology.The position is focused on teaching and not research. As a lecturer in our group you will contribute to a strongly internationally oriented teaching programme at Wageningen University. The duties/responsibilities of the position include:  Coordinate and teach the courses related to software engineering and information technology.Supervise and mark students' papers.Mark exams.Supervise students' theses and internships.Assist in building and sharing digital learning environments. You will also be a strong team player. You will collaborate with colleagues and thesis students focusing on software engineering and information technology. In the long-term perspective it is expected that you will grow towards the function of education coordinator of the INF group. Coaching will be provided to accomplish all of the above.Functie-eisenYou are an ambitious and enthusiastic lecturer devoted to excellence in education in Software Engineering and Information Technology. Further, you have: Preferably a PhD degree in computer science, information technology, software engineering, or a related area;a solid background and experience in the field of software engineering and information technology;good didactic qualities and enthusiasm for teaching and working with students.teaching experience with a clear vision on education, demonstrating both commitment and success in effective and inspirational participation in the teaching programme of the INF group;the ability to significantly contribute to the teaching and administration of subjects (including curriculum development) within the range of subjects offered by the INF group;experience and interest in working in interdisciplinary teams;excellent communication skills and team spirit;Having teaching-related training and certificates are considered a plus;The successful applicant is expected to either already hold the Dutch University Teaching Qualification (UTQ; in Dutch "BKO") or should complete it within 2 years after starting the position. https://www.wur.nl/en/Jobs/Why-choose-Wageningen-University-Research/Your-development-in-focus/Educational-Staff-Development.htmConditionsWe offer a creative and inspiring working environment. Initially, the employment is temporary for a period of one year. Job_title: PhD: Through-Process Modelling for Steel Product Development
Text: FunctieomschrijvingThis PhD project forms part of the Digitally Enhanced New Steel Product Development (DENS) program, in which Tata Steel Europe, Materials innovation institute (M2i) and several academic partners collaborate to enable the development of new generations of advanced materials for e.g. the automotive industry.Digitally Enhanced New Steel Product Development (DENS) programSignificant progress has been made in the past decades in the development of advanced models that describe the behavior of steel during processing and subsequent applications. However, the quantitative application of through process models in new steel product development still lacks predictivity. In modern steel grades, parameters of the steel production process have a significant influence on the final material properties. Furthermore, the trend towards complex multi-phase microstructures requires very sophisticated models to describe their mechanical properties in a predictive manner. The main scientific challenge addressed in this program is to integrate state-of-the-art models in a single through process model framework that can be applied in practice for new steel product development.The current Tata Steel efforts are towards developing oxide behaviour modules (OBM) that can be incorporated on the existing control or predictive models at industrial on-line control model. The existing oxide growth predictions in steel are based on empirical calculation of a rate of growth. Hence, in the practice, only empirical results are used obtained from experiments for each steel composition and each oxidation condition.This project is aimed at developing a generic thermal steel oxidation model. Including the effects on the internal and external oxidation behaviour of different steel phases and grain boundaries, and the effects of alloying elements. This model will govern the main features and phenomena occurring during manufacturing of strips. We will study/implement;- the composition, sequence, and amount of oxides depending on the steel, temperature cycle, and gas phase composition.- the oxidation-induced diffusion of elements in a multi-element and multi-phase alloy.- the effects of alloying elements on the oxidation steels.- the aspects of the steel microstructure, such as grain boundaries, on the oxidation behaviour.The model will be experimentally validated for pure iron and iron–carbon alloys.Functie-eisenThe PhD candidate should hold a Master degree in Physics, Chemistry, or Materials Science. Furthermore, the applicant should have: • ambition to do scientific work at a high level, as well as a strong orientation on result and process. • a strong affinity for physical-chemical modelling of solid materials and outstanding experimental competence to validate. • experience in multiphysics programs (Comsol or other) and programming in MatLab. • good communication skills (high degree of English proficiency) and the ability to work in a cross-organisational team, with industry stakeholders, academics and technicians.ConditionsThe TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, a discount for health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. An International Children’s Centre offers childcare and an international primary school. Dual Career Services offers support to accompanying partners. Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment; an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor; and a Doctoral Education Programme aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. Please visit graduateschool.tudelft.nl/ for more information.For more information about this position, please contact dr A.J. (Amarante) Böttger, E: A.J.Bottger@tudelft.nl, T: +31 (15) 27 82243.Minds for Innovation is the recruitment partner for this project. For more information regarding recruitment please contact Jolanda de Roo, E: j.deroo@m4i.nl, T: + 316 572 913 50. To apply, please visit the website www.m4i.nl/vacancies/ and use M4i's online application tool by 31 July 2018. When applying for this position, please refer to vacancy number 3ME17-81 in the subject of your motivation letter. https://mindsforinnovation.nl/vacancies/phd-position-through-process-modelling-for-steel-product-development-technical-university-of-delft-delft-the-netherlands/Additional informationJolanda de Roo+31 (6)-57291350j.deroo@m4i.nlTechnische Universiteit Delft

Job_title: PhD: Integrating chiral magnetic domain wall motion with photonics
Text: FunctieomschrijvingThe main subject of research is to experimentally study current induced chiral magnetic domain wall motion in (synthetic-) ferrimagnetic structures using state of the art fabrication and characterisation methods. The final aim is to integrate magnetic domain wall motion with photonic waveguides (detection and writing) within the larger NWO Zwaartekracht research project on Integrated NanoPhotonics of the Applied Physics and Electronic Engineering departments at the Eindhoven University of Technology.ResearchThe fascinating possibility to combine on-chip photonics and chiral magnetic domain wall motion in a single device directly combining high bandwidth data transport and storage may have a huge impact on the realization of future data and memory architectures. The recent demonstrations of highy efficient current induced chiral domain wall motion in ferrimagnetic structures and the all-optical-switching of magnetic domains bring this prospect one step further to reality. In the Zwaartekracht project on Integrated Nanophotonics at the TU/e and the Integrated Photonics Institute (IPI) we are aggressively exploring this multi-disciplinary approach which could add a revolutionary functionality to photonic circuits whilst breaking ground in the fundamentals of current induced domain wall motion in ferrimagnetic material systems.Physics of NanostructureThis project will be carried out in the group Physics of Nanostructure at the department of Applied Physics of the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e). The position is part of the Zwaartekracht project on Integrated NanoPhotonics.Functie-eisenFor this function we are looking for a talented and highly motivated experimental physics candidate which is able to combine multi-disciplinary experimental expertise to understand and tune magnetic interactions for efficient chiral domain wall motion and creativity to explore the integration of these structures into photonic integrated circuits. The candidate should (nearly) hold a Master of Science or equivalent degree in experimental physics with a preferred specialization in solid state physics and nanomaterials; any experience in the field of nanomagnetism, spintronics and integrated photonics is a big advantage. Candidates must prove a strong attitude towards experimental physics and the drive and capacity to tackle different aspects of a complex problem with large independence. The position is for four years and is embedded in a larger research cluster with other partners.Arbeidsvoorwaardena challenging job in a dynamic and ambitious university and a stimulating internationally renowned research environment;full-time temporary appointment for 4 years;gross salary between € 2.222,00 per month (first year) and € 2.840,00 per month (last year);Additionally, 8% holiday and 8.3% end-of-year annual supplements;an extensive package of fringe benefits (e.g. excellent technical infrastructure, the possibility of child care and excellent sports      facilities);Contract type: Temporary, 4 yearsAdditionele informatieInformationFor  information  concerning  employment  conditions  you  can  contact  Mrs. T.A.M. van Waterschoot, t.a.m.v.waterschoot@tue.nl.More information on employment conditions can be found here:  www.tue.nl/en/university/working-at-tue/working-conditions/. For more information about the project, please contact dr.ir. R. Lavrijsen, r.lavrijsen@tue.nl or prof.dr. B. Koopmans, B.Koopmans@tue.nl.ApplicationIf interested, please use 'apply now'-button at the top of this page. If you are interested in this position please send:a cover letter explaining your motivation and suitability for the position;a detailed Curriculum Vitae (including a list of publications and key achievements in research project(s));contact information of two references;copies of diplomas with course grades;Please keep in mind; you can upload only 5 documents up to 2 MB each

FunctieomschrijvingManaging Director KCAP Architects&PlannersAre you the new managing director of KCAP Architects&Planners?KCAP Architects&Planners is a leading international design firm specialised in architecture, urbanism and landscape design. KCAP holds offices in Rotterdam (NL), Zurich (CH) and Shanghai (CN) and works with a staff of more than a 100 talented international professionals on a wide range of projects throughout Europe and Asia. KCAP is known for the development of sustainable urban living environments, with buildings and public spaces that revitalise and renew the city. In our designs, we combine our experience with architecture, urban planning and landscape design to create social and spatial cohesion. Currently, KCAP is led by nine partners. The current Managing Director is retiring in the fourth quarter of this year. Therefore, KCAP is looking for a new Managing Director.As Managing Director you are responsible for the management of business operations of the Rotterdam location. This concerns finance, planning, business development, contract management and potentially HR and facility management. The Managing Director oversees  these departments, guides the responsible employees, decides daily business operations and prepares strategic decision making for the partners. He or she is responsible for the supervision of the business operations and periodically updates the partners. The Managing Director is a sparring partner and coach for the nine partners and a guardian of the continuity.The Managing Director is a person with a strong personality who acts as the chairman to the partners when it comes to business management. He or she is approachable and loyal, promotes consensus, but can also force decision making when necessary. The Managing Director is someone with a strategic outlook who oversees the different disciplines in the firm and who guards and promotes the unity within the company.The Managing Director has a feel for architecture,urban planningand landscape designand has knowledgeof or is willing to learn the specific characteristics of the field. He or she is internationally oriented and has notableexpertise, experience in and a vision forbusiness management. He or she is akeen negotiatorand sees through the sometimes complex processes quickly, maintains focus and makes a difference. The Managing Director is approachable, a skilled communicator and capable of dealing with a group of passionateprofessionals. Above all, the Managing Director has a pleasant personality. RequirementsThe Managing Director has a background in business management and operations, and/or finance (MSc or MBA) and an affinity with the creative sector. He or she is an experienced supervisor who is used to a dynamic organisation with strong personalities. He or she has authority and is a workable communicator without a 9 to 5 mentality. Fluency in English and Dutch is required, German and/or French are a plus.At KCAP, you come to work in a non-hierarchical, informal organisation where your own input and initiative are valued. You are sparring partner of the partners as well as for employees and management. The appointment is for a full-time position and the remuneration is in accordance with the job requirements.Please send your applications before the 25thof June to KCAP@vijfadvies.nlInformation: www.kcap.eu or Walter Huurdeman, VIJFadvies, 06-30217589BedrijfsomschrijvingKCAP Architects&Planners is a Dutch office for architecture, urban design and urban planning, founded by Kees Christiaanse in 1989. During the last 25 years KCAP has established itself as one of the leading international practices in the fields of architecture and urbanism.Field of work With a multi-disciplinary approach to complex design issues, KCAP has gained extensive experience in large-scale urban design and master planning, waterfront redevelopments, campus design and public transportation hubs. Architectural designs range from housing, education and care to public and utility buildings and mixed-use programs. KCAP develops concepts and visions that address sustainability, urbanization and infrastructure. KCAP is connected to various urban research programs.OfficesKCAP is based in Rotterdam and has two branch offices in Zurich (CH) and Shanghai (CN). KCAP Zurich was established in 2006 after winning two international design competitions in Zurich. KCAP Shanghai, established in early 2011, and supports KCAP’s growing portfolio in China.

FunctieomschrijvingPhiladelphia ondersteunt mensen met een beperking. Wij willen dat ieder mens mede dankzij ons werk het beste uit zichzelf kan halen.Voor het Control team van de Serviceorganisatie in Amersfoort is Philadelphia op zoek naar twee financiële professionals die hieraan een bijdrage willen leveren.Jouw bijdrage als controller is het faciliteren en organiseren van het optimaal “in control” zijn van Philadelphia zodat wij onze missie kunnen waarmaken. Je maakt financiële rapportages, scenarioanalyses en ontwikkelt businesscases die de Raad van Bestuur en andere beslissers ondersteunen bij het nemen van beslissingen. Je werkt zelfstandig en krijgt training on the job van senior controllers waardoor je je snel kunt ontwikkelen. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat je een bijdrage wilt leveren aan nieuwe ontwikkelingen zoals zelforganisatie, het ontwikkelen van een innovatief managementinformatiesysteem en de uitvoering van ons strategisch huisvestingsplan 2020. Functie-eisenJe bent een controller met een afgeronde financieel-economische of bedrijfskundige opleiding op academisch niveau en hebt twee tot vijf jaar relevante werkervaring of je bent recent afgestudeerd. Je hebt ambitie om de RC-opleiding of een vergelijkbare opleiding te gaan volgen. Je bent professioneel, communicatief vaardig en wilt jezelf ontwikkelen. Philadelphia zet in op zelforganisatie, dit betekent eigen verantwoordelijkheid nemen en samenwerken. Deze nieuwe ontwikkeling past goed bij hoe jij graag werkt. Je ziet kansen om het planning & control proces en andere “producten” van de afdeling Control te laten aansluiten bij de zorgprofessionals die (gaan) werken volgens zelforganisatie principes. Solliciteren Wij vragen je rechtstreeks bij Philadelphia te solliciteren door je curriculum vitae voor 21 juni met een motivatie naar info@werkenvoorphiladelphia.nl. te sturen. Je krijgt snel een bevestiging dat wij je sollicitatie hebben ontvangen. Binnen een week nodigen we je uit voor een sollicitatiegesprek of krijg je een persoonlijke toelichting waarom andere sollicitanten de voorkeur kregen. Job_title: Business Unit Manager Agro | Eurofins Agro NL
Text: FunctieomschrijvingWat is jouw opdracht?Met elkaar staan we voor de enorme uitdaging om iedereen in de wereld van gezond voedsel te voorzien, binnen de randvoorwaarde van een sluitende nutriëntenkringloop. Eurofins Agro kan met een compleet pakket van monstername, innovatieve analyses en heldere adviezen, ondernemers in de agrarische sector helpen om het productieproces bij te sturen.Het is jouw opdracht om de Business Unit Agro zo aan te sturen, dat deze ondernemers beter en intensiever worden geholpen in het effectief managen van hun productieprocessen. Met als resultaat een hogere opbrengst en kwaliteit en een lagere milieubelasting. Hoe ga je dat aanpakken?Eurofins Agro NL is recentelijk gewijzigd naar een Business Unit (BU) structuur. De organisatie is nu onderverdeeld in 3 BU's: Agro, Horticulture en Manure. De BU Agro vraagt om een algehele optimalisatie- en professionaliseringsslag met het uiteindelijke doel: groei!Je bent P&L verantwoordelijk voor het resultaat. Daarbij wordt gekeken naar onderzoeksduur, de kwaliteit van de analyses, het kostenniveau en de omzetdoelstellingen. Klanttevredenheid is het overkoepelende thema waarop wordt gestuurd.Op strategisch niveau definieer je kpi’s, doelen, milestones en manage je de voortgang. Speerpunten zijn het verbeteren van productiviteit en winstgevendheid. Een effectieve samenwerking tussen productie en sales, het introduceren van nieuwe (totaal)concepten, het vergroten van de markt en het stroomlijnen van processen dragen hieraan bij.Binnen de BU zijn 70 medewerkers werkzaam. Kennis, kunde en niveau ga je borgen door het aannemen, motiveren, ontwikkelen en behouden van excellente medewerkers. Je bent een voorbeeld voor je mensen en stuurt op passie en autonomie.Ook op groeps- en bedrijfsniveau draag jij je steentje bij. Samen met de collega BU Managers ga je voor het beste resultaat. Primair ligt de focus van de BU Agro op de Nederlandse markt. Eurofins Agro NL fungeert tevens als kenniscentrum voor Europa. Je initieert daarom ook (commerciële) activiteiten in de landen, bij en met collega's van de Europese Eurofins organisatie.   Je rapporteert aan de Managing Director van Eurofins Agro Nederland en werkt vanuit het kantoor in Wageningen.Functie-eisenWat breng je daarvoor mee?·       Gewend P&L verantwoordelijkheid te dragen·       Strategisch denker met pragmatische benadering·       Minimaal hbo opgeleid, succesvol trackrecord, helicopterview·       Affiniteit met de melkveesector en akker- en tuinbouw·       Ervaring met het managen van key accounts en strategische klanten·       Daadkrachtig, oplossingsgericht, veranderingsgezind·       Ervaring in het ontwikkelen en aansturen van een team, geeft anderen energie·       Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taalBedrijfsomschrijvingWaar ga je dit doen?Eurofins Scientific is een internationaal beursgenoteerde organisatie met meer dan 35.000 medewerkers in meer dan 375 laboratoria verspreid over 41 landen. Eurofins is wereldleider op het gebied bio-analytische testen voor voeding, water, milieu en farmaceutische producten. Daarnaast is Eurofins een van de grootste aanbieders ter wereld in een groeiend aantal markten zoals de agrarische sector en op het gebied van genomics. De organisatie maakt daarbij gebruik van een unieke hoeveelheid analysemethoden en een ongekend hoog kennisniveau en expertise.Eurofins Agro Nederland is informatieleverancier en kennispartner voor de akker- en tuinbouw, melkveehouderij en glastuinbouwsector. Met een compleet pakket van monstername, innovatieve analyses en heldere adviezen geven zij ondernemers in de argrarische sector handvatten voor productzekerheid en rendementsverbetering. Op jaarbasis worden ruim 500.000 monsters geanalyseerd. Eurofins Agro Nederland heeft vestigingen in Wageningen en Graauw en biedt werk aan ruim 300 medewerkers.Binnen Eurofins Agro Nederland zijn melkveehouderij en akker- en tuinbouw samengebundeld in de Business Unit Agro. Het laboratorium is nauw verweven met boeren, adviesorganisaties en de agrarische industrie. Deze Business Unit is de grootste binnen Eurofins Agro Nederland.Wat krijg je ervoor terug?·       Focus op groei, innovatie, kennis en samenwerking·       Niet zomaar op de winkel te passen maar de uitdaging om deze BU verder te brengen·       Korte lijnen, directe communicatie, waardering voor initiatief·       Kans om een bijdrage te leveren aan een betere wereld·       Werken voor een gezonde organisatie met een uniek concept·       Doorgroeimogelijkheden, ook internationaalHeb je interesse?Reageer dan nu! Voor meer informatie over deze uitdagende vacature (AGRO181) neem je contact op met Reinout Janssens of Vivanne Geurtz via 088 - 6070100. Kijk ook eens op de website van Eurofins.

FunctieomschrijvingAls Business Operations & Strategy Manager werk je op het snijvlak van business operations management en digital product management. Je levert grote impact door in een digitaal gedreven operatie, door middel van experimenteren, succesvolle producten en services te realiseren. Je realiseert continu operationele verbeteringen voor snellere processing en zorgt dat nieuwe fintech wordt geladen met als doel een betere klantervaring neer te zetten. Verantwoordelijkheden:Implementeren van nieuwe producten, services en verbeteringen in Business Operations en ITFaciliteren van het opstellen, monitoren en realiseren van operationele KPI’s Managen van pilots om de impact van verbeteringen te valideren en aan te scherpenLeiden van een continue verbetercyclus en faciliteren van zelf verbeterende teams Optimaliseren van de Customer Journey om procestijd te verkorten en klanttevredenheid te verhogenVerantwoordelijk voor de operationele alignment van veranderingen in de organisatieManagen van verbeterpunten uit risk assessments en auditsFunctie-eisenAfgeronde academische opleiding Enkele jaren relevante ervaring binnen business operations, consultancy of project/product management Ambitie om stevige uitdagingen met een groot groeipotentieel aan te pakken Ondernemend, gedreven en resultaatgerichtAnalytisch sterk, helikopter view en in staat om nieuwe onderwerpen snel eigen te makenFlexibele instelling, hoog energieniveau en een betrokken teamspeler Je kan helder en bondig formuleren, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk in Nederlands en EngelsArbeidsvoorwaardenWerken bij een fintech scale-up bedrijf in een jong en energiek team dat snel groeitPrachtige werklocatie in het centrum van Rotterdam, aan de Maas naast de ErasmusbrugMarktconform salaris met een maximale bonus van 20% afhankelijk van prestatieMaximaal € 60.000 exclusief bonus BedrijfsomschrijvingBEEQUIP is een nieuwe financier van zwaar materiaal (equipment) voor de bouw, infra en logistieke sector. Als fintech bedrijf in de scale-up fase is het doel van BEEQUIP om Nederlandse MKB-bedrijven te helpen groeien met behulp van equipment leasing oplossingen. BEEQUIP vindt dat de financiering van het equipment bijna altijd mogelijk moet zijn. Zij kijkt verder dan bedrijfscijfers, kasstromen en contracten door eerst de waarde van het equipment te beoordelen. Gebruikt materieel in goede staat van onderhoud weet BEEQUIP op waarde te schatten. Met deze kennis in huis kan BEEQUIP het materieel van een onderneming zelf waarderen en een passende leaseoplossing bieden. Het team is jong, dynamisch en ondernemend. Vanuit hartje Rotterdam bouwt BEEQUIP aan een leasemaatschappij van deze tijd en de organisatie groeit hard.

Van Leeuwen Buizen volgt de CAO Metalektro.Van Leeuwen Buizen biedt een uitdagende functie binnen een dynamisch, internationaal opererend bedrijf, waar ondernemend en creatief werken centraal staat.BedrijfsomschrijvingDe Van Leeuwen Buizen Groep is een wereldwijd opererende handelsonderneming en specialist in stalen buizen en buistoepassingen. Vanuit een wereldwijd netwerk van voorraadhoudende vestigingen biedt Van Leeuwen een breed pakket aan buisproducten en diensten op maat. Het bedrijf is in vrijwel alle industriële sectoren actief en telt zo’n veertig vestigingen verspreid over Europa, het Midden-Oosten, Azië, Australië en Noord-Amerika. Bij de Van Leeuwen Buizen Groep werken meer dan 1.100 medewerkers wereldwijd, waarvan 370 bij Van Leeuwen Buizen in Nederland.Binnen Commercie werken 75 mensen, waarvan 23 binnen de Business Unit Specific Distribution. FunctieomschrijvingThis research project is a cooperation between DIAM, the Faculty of Materials Science and Engineering and Tata Steel Europe. Your principal work place will be at DIAM in Delft. But on a regular base you will work at the Lab of Tata Steel in IJmuiden (NL). Here you will meet and work together with researchers from Tata and other PhD researchers. The large multidisciplinary project (with a total of 17 PhD students involved) is on finding relations between process parameters in steel production and mechanical properties of the resulting product.This project needs knowledge of the various physical processes involved in steel production, knowledge on how to measure relevant parameters and also knowledge on mathematical and statistical modelling of the data. In this project it is your role to bring in the needed mathematical and statistical knowledge, insights and methods for better predictive modelling.A central role in the project is taken by so-called microstructural quantities of the steel. On one hand these are influenced by the process parameters that can be controlled. On the other hand, these influence the mechanical properties of the product. Microstructural quantities include grain and particle size, grain shape, orientation and mis-orientations, spatial distributions, and anisotropy. Characterisation techniques can obtain profiles of 2D sections of 3D samples. First, the formation of microstructures should be described using a realistic and physically inspired stochastic model. Then, the stochastic behaviour of the 2D visible features will need to be expressed to extract information on the statistics of important 3D features. The focus is on joint behaviour of features as well as (joint) extremal behaviour. The challenge in this project is to use state-of-the-art models from materials science and develop statistical methodology to address the stereological problems. Nonparametric estimation, extreme value statistics, and stochastic simulation will be important subjects.Functie-eisenThe candidate possesses an MSc degree in mathematics, physics, computer science (specialised in machine learning), or another relevant area. Additional qualifications: • Strong interest in statistical methodology, physical applications, and computational methods. • Proficiency in reading and writing scientific papers in English. • Ambition, motivation, and good communication skills (high level of English proficiency).     ConditionsThe TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, a discount for health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. An International Children’s Centre offers childcare and an international primary school. Dual Career Services offers support to accompanying partners. Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment; an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor; and a Doctoral Education Programme aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. Please visit graduateschool.tudelft.nl/ for more information. Additional informationMinds for Innovation is the recruitment partner for this project. For more information regarding recruitment please contact Jolanda de Roo. E: j.deroo@mindsforinnovation.nl, T: + 316 572 913 50For more information on the project specifics, you can e-mail Prof. Geurt Jongbloed. FunctieomschrijvingThe associate/full professor is expected to develop an internationally leading research track record in Geometry, leading to an autonomous research programme. We are looking for a leader in an area within Algebraic Geometry or Differential Geometry. These fields are central areas of Geometry, and they have strong connections to subjects like Algebraic Topology, Mathematical Physics, Harmonic Analysis, (discrete and continuous) Optimization, Number Theory, Coding Theory, and Cryptography.The research should lead to publications in high impact scientific journals and to contributions to major conferences in the field of expertise. Supervision of PhD students and postdocs is an important part of the research activities. A strong involvement in the research theme Data Science and Systems Complexity or Cognitive Systems is expected. The successful candidate will contribute to the teaching within the bachelor and master programmes of Mathematics in the Undergraduate and Graduate Schools of Science and Engineering of the FSE. He/she contributes both to teaching existing courses, and to the development of new courses in mathematics engineering. The candidate is expected to have an active interest in and to provide a positive contribution to the management and organizational tasks of the institute. At the level of the FSE, the candidate will contribute to the organization of the faculty, for example by participating in working groups and committees in the fields of teaching, research and management. The candidate will participate in relevant national and international organizations.Functie-eisenYou have:• a PhD degree in the field of Mathematics or related discipline• a minimum of two years postdoctoral experience abroad (industrial experience can partially compensate for this requirement)• excellent research qualities, as evidenced by a publication record in international peer-reviewed journals, and a relevant international network• teaching and organizational experience appropriate to career stage• fulfilled the requirements for the University Teaching Qualification• evidence of successful acquisition of external funding appropriate to career stage.You are:• a team player with good communications skills• willing to learn the Dutch language.ConditionsThe appointment of Associate Professor will be a tenured appointment. The gross monthly salary, dependent on qualifications and work experience, will be from € 4,815 (salary scale 13 Dutch Universities) up to a maximum of € 6,438 (scale 14) gross per month for a full-time position. There will be an assessment at the end of a 4-7 -years period for the promotion to full professor.The appointment of Full Professor will be a tenured appointment. The gross monthly salary, dependent on qualifications and work experience, will be from € 5,334 up to a maximum of € 7,766 (salary scale H2 Dutch Universities) for a full-time position.In addition to the primary salary the University offers 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.ApplicationsYou may apply for this position until 14 August 23:59h / before 15 August 2018 Dutch local time by means of the application form (click on ‘Apply’ below on this advertisement on the university website).Interested candidates are invited to submit a complete application including:• a letter of motivation• a curriculum vitae, including a list of publications• a list of five self selected ‘best papers’• a statement about teaching goals and experience and a description of scientific interest and plans• the names of three references complete with title and contact information.The University of Groningen provides career services for partners of new faculty members moving to Groningen.The University of Groningen has adopted an active policy to increase the number of female scientists across all disciplines of the university. Therefore, female candidates are especially encouraged to apply.Unsolicited marketing is not appreciated.InformationProf. J.B.T.M.
